H0.text: Clouds and dust absorb, scatter, or reflect most incoming solar radiation in the atmosphere.

H1.text: Clouds and sand absorb, scatter, or reflect most incoming solar radiation in the atmosphere.

H2.text: Ice and dust absorb, scatter, or reflect most incoming solar radiation in the atmosphere.

H3.text: Coulds and minerals absorb, scatter, or reflect most incoming solar radiation in the atmosphere.

A4.text: Another portion of the incident energy is reflected, with the two most important atmospheric reflectors being dust and clouds.

A5.text: Depending on the properties of the aerosol, clouds can reflect up to 70% of the incident radiation.
